title: How many digits used for numbering 1-100

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1-9 ,    9 digits used for these 9 numbers
10-99, 180 digits used for these 90 numbers
100,  3 digits used for this number"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9+180+3 = 192"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of the solutions to the logarithmic equation\n"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large x^{\\log x} = 10^{2 - 3 \\log x + 2 (\\log x )^{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"\nwhere "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\log x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the logarithm of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the base "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\quad \LARGE {\quad x^{\log x} = 10^{2 - 3 \log x + 2 (\log x )^{2}} \\
\Rightarrow log x^{log x}=2-3log x+2(log x)^2 \\
\Rightarrow log x\times log x=2-3log x+2(log x)^2 \\
\Rightarrow (log x)^2=2-3log x+2(log x)^2\\
\Rightarrow (log x)^2-3log x+2=0\\
\Rightarrow y^2-3y+2=0 \quad \boxed{\color{#3D99F6}\text{Let, log x=y}}\\
\Rightarrow (y-2)(y-1)=0\\
\Rightarrow y=2\quad \quad \quad \quad \quad or, y=1\\
\Rightarrow log x=2\quad \quad \Rightarrow log x=1\\
\therefore  x=100\quad \quad \quad\therefore  x=10}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now the summation of solution is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=100+10=\boxed{110}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the smallest positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that there exists a positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" whose sum of divisors is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7,1249"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are prime and therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sigma_1(8743) = \sigma_1(7)\sigma_1(1249) = 8\times1250 = 10000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k \le 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It is simple enough to check the values of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sigma_1(n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \le n \le 1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to see that it is not possible for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sigma_1(n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to be equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k = \boxed{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For interest, the other number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sigma_1(n) = 10000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9481 = 19 \times 499"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using Mathematica we can find the first few "},{"type":"text","text":"n","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" numbers    "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Rest@Select[Range@100000, IntegerQ[Log10@DivisorSigma[1, #]] &]"}],"attrs":[{"text":"Rest@Select[Range@100000, IntegerQ[Log10@DivisorSigma[1, #]] &]","language":null}]},{"type":"text","text":"    "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which returns "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{8743, 9481, 71193, 94981, 98671, 99301}"}],"attrs":[{"text":"{8743, 9481, 71193, 94981, 98671, 99301}","language":null}]},{"type":"text","text":"       "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so the k numbers we are looking for are "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4, 4, 5, 5, 5, 5"}],"attrs":[{"text":"4, 4, 5, 5, 5, 5","language":null}]},{"type":"text","text":"    "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so the smallest k is "},{"type":"text","text":"4","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1, 1, 0, Go!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large { {9227465 \, 5702887 \, 3524578 \ldots 5 \, 3 \, 2 \, 1 \, 1 \, 0} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The above expression shows the "},{"type":"text","text":"concatenation","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" of the "},{"type":"text","text":"Fibonacci numbers","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" less than or equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" written backwards."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"L "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" denote the number of digits and the sum of digits, respectively, of this large number. What can you say about the number obtained from the expression given below?
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \dfrac1{10} \left[ (S-L) \pmod{2016} \right] "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

title: 110th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"An improvised rocket is launched from the top of a building "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"150 \text{ feet}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" high. The height"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{ (H) }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"reached by the rocket after"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{ (t) }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"seconds is given by the function:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large H( t ) =40t-10{ t }^{ 2 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How long (in seconds) did it take to reach the highest point?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many holes are in a polo?"}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Look at this proof "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"let x = 1 , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=1 , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2=x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-----------------------------(1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-1=x-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x-1)(x+1)=x-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-----------------(2)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+1 = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , which is equal to 2=1 Q.E.D---------(3)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Where did the "proof" get wrong ?"}]}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n be any natural number. Is it always true that n has a (nonzero) multiple \nwhose representation (base 10) contains only zeroes and ones?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We employ the famous and useful "pigeon-hole 
principle": If there are more pigeons than holes, then some hole 
must contain at least two pigeons. There are only n numbers "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
modulo n, but the set {1,11, 111, 1111,... }, whose largest member has 
n+1 digits, has size n + 1; thus, it contains two numbers whose 
values are equal modulo n. Subtract one from the other!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"On a clock, what is the smaller angle in degrees formed by the hour hand and the minute hand at 11:11?\nWrite your answer with one decimal place.\n"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/C6ap1hCSsD-1111.png?width=1200"}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Trung Le","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":", you should mention that the answer is in degree."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"At "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11:00"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the two hands are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" apart.  Let the hour-hand and minute-hand move "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta_h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta_m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" minutes respectively.  Then, the smaller angle between the two hands is given by:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \theta & = 30 - \theta_h + \theta_m \\ & = 30 - \frac{11}{60} \times 30 + \frac{11}{60} \times 360 \\ & = 30 - 5.5 + 66 \\ & = \boxed{90.5} \end{aligned}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{12} \times 360^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" stands for angle made by hour hand separately added in before being minus by how much it has traveled slightly for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{11}{12 \times 60} \times 360^\circ."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            At 11:00 the hour-hand is at the 11 mark and the minute-hand is at the 12 mark.  The angle between them is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{360^\circ}{12} = 30^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  In the 11 minutes that follows, the hour-hand moves "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta_h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" forward reducing the angle between the two hands, therefore there is a minus sign before it, that is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-\theta_h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  During the same time, the minute-hand moving forward by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta_m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"increasing the angle between them, therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+\theta_m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Therefore, the equation: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta = 30 - \theta_h + \theta_m "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In 1 hour or 60 minutes the hour-hand moves "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", therefore in 11 minutes, it moves, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta_h = \dfrac{11}{60} \times 30^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Similarly, in 11 minutes, the minute-hand moves "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta_m = \dfrac{11}{60} \times 360^\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There is a simple relation to find out the angle i.e. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"30H-\frac{11}{2}M"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"..........[WITHOUT SIGNS] "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
This gives the larger angle which is 269.5 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
So the smaller angle is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{90.5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the minimum possible 4-digit integer of the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{xxyy}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which is a multiple of 11 and when divided by 11, gives another multiple of 11 with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x-y=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"dividing  XXYY by 11 gives X0Y 
therefore X+Y=11
 given X-Y=1 
solving the two equations we get x=6 , y=5"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
